fields.name: theme
fields.label: Domain / Topic
fields.short_description: Domain or topic of the dataset.
fields.long_description: The theme or topic of the package.

fields.short_description: Title for the Dataset.
fields.long_description: Title for the dataset. Often assigned by creator or publisher.

fields.name: unique_identifier
fields.label: Identifier
fields.short_description: Unique identifier for the dataset.
fields.long_description: Unique identifier for the dataset. Often assigned by creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: A description of the dataset.
fields.long_description: A description of the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset.
fields.long_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: access_category
fields.label: Access category
fields.short_description: Type of access granted for the dataset (open, closed, etc).
fields.long_description: Access category provides a description of the licensing rights for accessing the dataset. Often provided by the rights owner, creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset.
fields.long_description: Keywords/tags categorizing the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.short_description: Author of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Author's name or authoring organization for the dataset.

fields.name: owner
fields.label: Owner
fields.short_description: Author of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Author's name or authoring organization for the dataset.

fields.name: published_date
fields.label: Published Date
fields.short_description: Published date of the dataset.
fields.long_description: Published date of the dataset. Often provided by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: time_span_start
fields.label: Time Span (start date)
fields.short_description: Start date of the data in the dataset.
fields.long_description: First date the data was collected for. This is not the date it was collected but the earliest date of the data values.

fields.name: time_span_end
fields.label: Time Span (end date)
fields.short_description: End date of time data in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Last date the data was collected for. This is not the date it was collected but the latest date of the data values.

fields.name: geo_span
fields.label: GeoSpatial Area Span
fields.short_description: A spatial region or named place the dataset covers.
fields.long_description: This data represents the geospatial area the dataset covers. This may be captured as a data column or simply defined by the creator or publisher.

fields.name: contains_individual_data
fields.label: Contains Individual Data
fields.short_description: Does the data hold individualized data?
fields.long_description: Does the data hold individualized data? If yes, the dataset is aggregated at the individual level.

fields.name: contains_identifiable_individual_data
fields.label: Contains Identifiable Data
fields.short_description: Does the data hold identifiable individual data?
fields.long_description: Does the data hold identifiable individual data that can be used to uniquely identify an individual data was collected about? If yes, the dataset is not anonymized.

fields.name: contains_indigenous_data
fields.label: Contains Indigenous Data
fields.short_description: Does the data hold data about Indigenous communities?
fields.long_description: Does the data hold data about Indigenous communities? If yes, the dataset should comply with OCAP principles (Ownership, Control, Access, Possession). See https://fnigc.ca/ocap-training/ for more information.

fields.name: limits_on_use
fields.label: Limits on use
fields.short_description: Limits on use of data.
fields.long_description: Limits on use (e.g., academic purposes). Information provided generally provides more detail on the terms and access rights beyond the license. Usually provided by the rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: access_steward
fields.label: Access Rights Stewart
fields.short_description: Who to contact regarding access.
fields.long_description: The access rights stewart is the point of contact (either a person or an organization) to gain access to the dataset. Usually provided by the rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: indigenous_access_steward
fields.label: Who gave permission (for Indigenous data)
fields.short_description: Who to contact regarding access to a dataset that has data about Indigenous communities.
fields.long_description: The Indigenous access rights stewart is the point of contact (either a person or an organization) to gain access to the dataset. It is an agent that has the right to manage access rights to Indigenous data. That person can be Indigenous themselves or a non-Indigenous agent that acts as the stewart for access rights to the data. Usually provided by the previous rights owner, creator, or publisher.

fields.name: indigenous_span
fields.label: The Indigenous communities the dataset is about.
fields.short_description: Indigenous communities from which data is derived.
fields.long_description: Indigenous communities from which data is derived. this represents the community coverage of the communities that provided the data or are the subject of data stored in the dataset.

fields.name: language
fields.label: Language
fields.short_description: Language(s) of the dataset
fields.long_description: Language(s) of the dataset capture what language the data is in. It does not reflect the langage o the metadata associated with it.

fields.name: persistent_identifier
fields.label: Persistent Identifier
fields.short_description: Data is identified by a persistent identifier.
fields.long_description: Data is identified by a persistent identifier. A unique identifier can be in any format, as long as it is unique ithn some context. Often, this is stored as a unique resource identifier (URI).

fields.name: global_unique_identifier
fields.label: Globally Unique Identifier
fields.short_description: Data is identified by a persistent and globaly unique identifier.
fields.long_description: Data is identified by a persistent and globaly unique identifier. A unique identifier can be in any format, as long as it is globaly unique. Often, this is stored as a unique resource identifier (URI).

fields.name: description_document
fields.label: Link to dataset description
fields.short_description: A URL to an external document describing the dataset.
fields.long_description: A URL to an external document describing the dataset. Often this would be a website that provides additional details about the daatset. it can lso be a document (e.g. PDF) or a resource of some sort (e.g. LinkedData object).

fields.name: temporal_resolution
fields.label: Temporal resolution
fields.short_description: Describes how granular the date/time data in the dataset is.
fields.long_description: Describes how granular the date/time data in the dataset is. Usually, this explains the level of aggregation provided by the dtaset. For example, timeseries data can be by minute, hour, year, or season.

fields.name: geospatial_resolution
fields.label: GeoSpatial resolution
fields.short_description: Describes how granular gospatial data is in the dataset.
fields.long_description: Describes how granular geospatial data is in the dataset. Usually, this explains the level of aggregation provided by the dtaset. For example, geospatial information can be at the city, province, region, or country level. It can also be stored as a polygon defined by longitude/lanitude coordindates.

fields.label: Data complies with a community standard (RDA-R1.3-01D)
fields.name: fair_rda_r1_3_01d
fields.short_description: This indicator requires that data complies with community standards. (FAIR ID = RDA-R1.3-01D).
fields.long_description: This indicator is linked to the following principle: R1.3: (Meta)data meet domainrelevant community standards. The indicator can be evaluated by verifying that the data follows a community standard. A service like the RDA-endorsed FAIRsharing could be helpful to identify the relevant standards. The indicator can be evaluated by verifying that the data follows a community standard. A service like the RDA-endorsed FAIRsharing could be helpful to identify the relevant standards.

fields.label: Data uses knowledge representation expressed in standardised format (RDA-I1-01D)
fields.name: fair_rda_i1_01d
fields.short_description: The indicator serves to determine that an appropriate standard is used to express knowledge, in particular the data model and format (FAIR ID = RDA-I1-01D).
fields.long_description: This indicator is linked to the following principle: I1: (Meta)data use a formal, accessible, shared, and broadly applicable language for knowledge representation. The indicator can be evaluated by looking at information about the data model and format, verifying that the standard used is appropriate for the domain and the type of digital object. Deciding on the appropriateness of the knowledge representation may be based on its inclusion in a registry like the one developed by FAIRsharing.

fields.label: Data uses machine-understandable knowledge representation (RDA-I1-02D)
fields.name: fair_rda_i1_02d
fields.short_description: This indicator focuses on the machine-understandability aspect of the data. This means that data should be readable and thus interoperable for machines without any requirements such as specific translators or mappings (FAIR ID = RDA-I1-02D).
fields.long_description: This indicator is linked to the following principle: I1: (Meta)data use a formal, accessible, shared, and broadly applicable language for knowledge representation. This indicator can be evaluated by looking at the knowledge representation model used for the expression of the data. Examples are RDF, OWL, JSON-LD, Data Cube, the Generalized Data Model for clinical research and SKOS. Information about models and formats can be looked up in a registry like the RDA endorsed FAIRsharing (see for example: https://fairsharing.org/standards/?q=&selected_facets=type_exact:model/format).

fields.label: Data uses FAIR-compliant vocabularies (RDA-I2-01D)
fields.name: fair_rda_i2_01d
fields.short_description: The indicator requires the controlled vocabulary used for the data to conform to the FAIR principles, and at least be documented and resolvable using globally unique and persistent identifiers. The documentation needs to be easily findable and accessible (FAIR ID = RDA-I2-01D).
fields.long_description: This indicator is linkedto the following principle: I2 : (Meta)data use vocabularies that follow the FAIR principles. The indicator can be evaluated by verifying that each of the vocabularies used in the data is documented and resolvable using globally unique and persistent identifiers, with the documentation being easily findable and accessible. Typically, the reference to the specification of the vocabularies used will be included in the documentation of the digital object or the repository where it is kept.

fields.label: Data includes references to other data (RDA-I3-01D )
fields.name: fair_rda_i3_01d
fields.short_description: This indicator is about the way data is connected to other data, for example linking to previous or related research data that provides additional context to the data (FAIR ID = RDA-I3-01D).
fields.long_description: This indicator is linked to the following principle: I3: (Meta)data include qualified references to other (meta)data. The indicator can be evaluated by looking at the presence of references to other data in the data. For example, there may be links to other resources in cells in a spreadsheet, or in RDF-based data.

fields.label: Data includes qualified references to other data
fields.name: fair_rda_i3_02d

fields.label: Data is accessible through an access protocol that supports authentication and authorisation
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_2_01d

fields.label: Data can be accessed manually (i.e., with human intervention)
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_02d

fields.label: Data identifier resolves to a digital object
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_03d

fields.label: Data is accessible through standardised protocol
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_04d

fields.label: Data can be accessed automatically (i.e. by a computer program)
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_05d

fields.label: Data is accessible through a free access protocol
fields.name: fair_rda_a1_1_01d
